alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:56AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 32.8 feet, Most roads in the lower Milk River Valley are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Friday the stage was 28.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM MDT Friday was 28.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 32.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.0 feet on 10/06/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1100 AM MDT.
